place.name: CRIMPLESHAM
place.gazetteerText: CRIMPLESHAM, a parish in Downham district, Norfolk; 3 miles E of Downham r. station. Post town, Downham. Acres, 1, 620. Real property, £3, 797. Pop., 328. Houses, 71. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £69. Patron, the Bishop of Norwich. The church has a tower, and is good: and there is a fuel allotment £23. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
